intro: Sida carpinifolia var. brevicuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-spike sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. This variety is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to stabilize soil.
